ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: If you had the chance to participate in another incentive program for reducing alcohol use in pregnancy or lactation, would you volunteer again?
Please include any comments regarding your response to apx1_7
How did you feel when you had to provide breath or urine samples?
Notes: 1 = Not at all comfortable; 5 = Very Comfortable

ElementDescription: How did you feel about your picture being taken when you provided breath or urine samples?
Notes: 1 = Not at all comfortable; 5 = Very Comfortable

ElementDescription: How helpful has this incentive program been in helping you abstain from alcohol use?
Notes: 1 = Not at all helpful; 5 = Very helpful

ElementDescription: How helpful has this program been in helping your infant stay healthy?
Notes: 1 = Not at all helpful; 5 = Very helpful

ElementDescription: How do you feel about accessing support remotely via mobile technology such as texting?
Notes: 1 = Not at all helpful; 5 = Very helpful

ElementDescription: Would you feel comfortable communicating and consulting with health professionals via video function as a mobile technology to remotely access support?
Notes: 1 = Not at all comfortable; 5 = Very Comfortable

ElementDescription: Who would you like to get individual support from the most: Health professional?
Who would you like to get individual support from the most: Peers?
Who would you like to get individual support from the most: Family or relatives?
Who would you like to get individual support from the most: Friends?
Who would you like to get individual support from the most: Health professional, peers, family or relatives, and friends (all of the above)?
Who would you like to get individual support from the most: Other?
If you selected Other for who you would like to get individual support from, please explain.
How did financial incentives given to you in this study impact your life?
What are the positives the financial incentives gave you: (for example, gave me financial freedom)?
What are the negatives the financial incentives gave you: (for example, my family pressured me to submit samples)?
How did you use the money earned in this study?
What other types of incentives (both tangible and non-tangible) would you accept that would be rewarding to remain abstinent from alcohol use?
We would love to hear from you about how we could make this program better for you or others like you in the future. Feel free to make suggestions and/or tell us what you liked or did not like.
